div.l: Here lith the Millere / and his wyf also
And forth he goth / on twenty deuylway
Vn to the bedde ther as the Miller lay
He wende haue cropen / by his felawe Iohn
And by the Millere / In he crepe a noon
And caught hym by the nekke / and softe he spake
He seyde thow Iohn / thow swynes heed a wake
For cristes saule / and here a noble game
For that lorde that called is seint Iame
As I haue thries in this short nyght
Swyued the Millers doughter vpright
While thow haste as coward been a gaste
Ye fals harlot quod the Miller haste
Thow shalt a bye by goddis dignyte
A fals traitour fals clerke quod he
Who durste be so bolde to disꝑparge
My doughter that is comen of such lynage
And by the throte bolle he caught AlaeynAleynAlayn
And hent hym dispituously a gayn
And on the nose he smote hym with his feistefistefeste
Doun ranne the blody streme vppon his breste
And in the flore with nose / and mouth to broke
They walwen as two pygges in a poke
Vp they goon and doun ayein a noononnonnoonHand 1 self-corrected "non" with intralinear "o"; Hand 2 erased the correction and overwrote the original "n" with "o." The final "n" appears to be Hand 1.
Til that the Millere / spurned at a stoon
A doun he felle bakward vpon his wyfe
That wist no thyng of this nyce stryfe
For she was falle a slepe / a litil wyght
With Iohn the Clerke / that waked had al nyght
And with the falle oute of hire slepe breide
Helpe holy crosse of Bromeholme she seide
In manus tuas lorde to the I calle
A wake Symkyn the fende is on me I falle
Myn herte broken helpe I nam but deede
Ther beth on my wombe and on myn heede
Helpe Symkyn for the fals clerkys fight
This Iohn stirt vp as fast as eủer he myght
And gropeth by the walle too and fro
To fynde a staffe / and she stirt vp also
